data.title: Good fast food
data.text: First time here. This was the best fast food I ever had. Good service and fast.I will have to thy my local unit, (St. Cloud) first chance I get.

data.title: Glad I was running late!
data.text: I was running late for dinner and I saw this Firehouse Subs restaurant so I ran in to grab something. What a great choice that was. The subs are huge..1/2 is a meal all by itself. The bread is hearty and fresh and the turkey, cheese, veggies and bacon on my sub were abundant. They even had a veggie sub for my husband. They heat the sandwiches and it makes for a very tasty meal. The employees were friendly and helpful. I didn't eat in the restuarant but it seemed nice and clean. The prices were reasonable too. Firehouse Subs is now my favorite sub shop.

data.title: Excellent warm subs
data.text: I'd never had much in the way of warm subs until I went to Firehouse Subs in Belmar. They have a nice selection of subs  in suitable sizes for small or big eaters. I thought the Hero and the BBQ with cheese were both excellent. Something about the warm sub bread roll and the warm fixings inside just make it delicious and my favorite over other sub shops

data.title: First time here...
data.text: Have seen Firehouse Subs commercials on television, decided to give it a try.  We had the Club on a Sub & a Tuna Sub.  The cashier was polite and helpful with a couple of questions.  Do not usually review fast food places, but had a good experience and I wanted to let them know.  Would visit Firehouse again...

data.title: Delicious Subs and our kids loved them!
data.text: This is the best Sub Shoppe and it's with a firehouse theme! Our boys ages 6 and 4 loved the food. Our 4 yr old has never eaten a sandwich like the "I believe it was the smokehouse brisket sub" that had cheese. Another good one was the Hero sub. The boys were given fireman hats. They love firemen and fire trucks. I'm hooked with one visit. Friendly staff we will be back!

data.title: The most Consistent Sub shop in America
data.text: I have been to Firehouse Sub shops in three states so far.They have always been very consistent with and cleanness, food quality and service. They always greet you as you come in "Welcome to Firehouse". No matter what sub you order, you received an original sub just like it is to be! Even at home I go to Firehouse once a week! The Steak & Cheese or The Hook * ladder are my favorites.

data.title: Good food reasonable priced
data.text: These are the only subs I want now.  Goodbye other sub shops!  The New York steamer is my favorite!  They are large, so my son and I usually order the combo and split the sandwich.  The Hook and Ladder is another good one!

data.title: Best Subs Around
data.text: Ive eaten here 3 times now and the food is consistently excellent as is the service.  They are fast, friendly and make a great sub.

data.title: Delicious!!!!
data.text: While attending a conference in Lakewood (a suburb of Denver), we stumbled upon Firehouse Subs.  I had their special "Hawaiian pulled pork" sandwich.  It was the best pulled pork I've ever had.  I was a little skeptical of the pork being covered in cole slaw but it was amazing!  It was huge and I was totally stuffed!

data.title: Good but super high calories
data.text: I loved my sandwich, the Italian, but it did have a lot of juiciness that made my bread soggy. Also the calories: 914 for a medium????  Maybe someone should work on that.

data.title: Firehouse rocks!!!
data.text: I  visited this unique and awesome sub shop last fall and was bowled over by their sandwiches! !! Do yourself a favor and try their excellent subs...you won't be disappointed! !!

data.title: Great selection, great subs
data.text: My first time at a Firehouse Subs - don't have them in our area. Certainly not like a Subway. There were some many good choices it was hard to pick just one. The three of us ordered three different kinds of subs and every one was delicious. The bread was soft, the meats were spiced just right, and the price was very reasonable. When you walked in they welcomed you like you were one of their favorite customers. In our travels across the country, Firehouse Subs will now be on my first choice list.

data.title: Closest to Italian Subs in Chicago I have Tasted in Colorado
data.text: I loved the subs, they were truly Italian as I learned what that meant growing up in Chicago. The bread was beautifully fresh - a commodity hard to produce in the dryness of Colorado. The unanimous greeting from all workers as we walked in the door seemed genuine. I loved this great food find.

data.title: Many Choices
data.text: The subs were delish and there were many choices. I did feel like they didn't have too many healthier options but who wants a healthy sub? The service was fantastic and everyone was very nice. I will go back for sure!

data.title: DELICIOUS!
data.text: Had to try this sub shop since it sounded like it was for fireman! Service is good, and food for hot subs is excellent. I had the steak with mushrooms. This was my second time to this location so I ordered two subs on this trip. Very good!

data.title: Aweful tasting food...and is this a charity or a restaurant?
data.text: Absolutely terrible food, among the worst subs I have ever had. I tried the 'King's Hawaiian' sandwhich, which I was able to take about 3 bites of before discarding the entire thing. Horrible, generic, soggy, bland...just an all around aweful tasting sandwhich. So, I ended up spending eight bucks on a iced tea and chips. In addition, they ask for your change to help firefighters, which I find to be extremely tacky. I mean, thank you for your services firemen, but should I start a restaurant to help postal workers, police officers...or maybe the girl scouts? To the 'firemen' who started this thing...learn to make a decent sandwhich, and quit trying to play on the heartstrings of the average stupid American, it is insulting. Will never return. Yuck!

data.title: Great prices
data.text: The restaurant has great food, great prices, generous portions.  This is the second Firehouse I have visited.  I usually order the house salad but their Chefs salads are very good to.  I prefer their BBQ sandwich or their Philly Cheese.  The only negative is the parking lot is small and shared with a Panera Bread and several other places in a mini mall.  Usually at lunch the lot  is crowded and some drivers hurrying to get back to work make it tricky to back out of the spaces.
